alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 12:12PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A Return of Winter Weather Monday Night into Tuesday... After a long warm and dry stretch, we will see a return of more appropriate winter-like conditions starting Monday night and continuing through Tuesday. The morning commute on Tuesday could be impacted. A band of valley rain and mountain snow will push into Humboldt county Monday evening, then spread south and east during the overnight into Tuesday morning. As the colder air filters in behind the cold front, valley rain should switch over to snow by early Tuesday morning. Snow showers will taper off from west to east later Tuesday afternoon and end across eastern Nevada mountains Tuesday night. Around an inch or less of snow for the valleys, with 1 to 4 inches for the mountains. Winds will also become breezy to windy from the southwest on Monday and especially on Tuesday with northerly winds behind the cold front. Some spots of blowing and drifting snow are possible, especially on higher passes and summits. Temperatures on Tuesday are expected to be 15 to 20 degrees colder than Monday, with highs only in the 30s to lower 40s. Motorists should remain alert to rapidly changing weather, and take necessary precautions if travel is necessary. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
